bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, April 21, 1948

div1.p: Lawrence Reed makes a suggestion for the form of the courtesy line for items loaned by his mother for the Hall of Fame program. He informs Hench that he was not stationed at Pinar del Rio.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, April 21, 1948

opener.dateline:
2810-36 Place NW
Washington 7. D C
April 21-48

div1.p:
Your letter of the 14th was
received and the enclosures were
read with much interest-

I think the courtesy line
should read “By courtesy of Mrs.
Walter Reed” I doubt if she
would get many request & if she
diddoes Blossom or I can handle them.

I never was stationed at
Pinar del Rio, all of my
service as a soldier was in
Havana, & later as a Lieut
in Cienfuegos, sorry I cant
give you any dope on Pinar del Rio

Just recieved notice from
Col Siler about the Exercises
to be held here in Washington on
May 12"

We are looking forward
to hearing your address.
